data.text:
Calling all Condor alumni

The OC Foundation is partnering with Oxnard College to share stories of resilience, passion, and inspiration to the entire community by reaching out to OC alumni.

Whether you took one class or you earned multiple degrees, we want to hear from you!

Complete the official Alumni Update to share your contact information and let us know what you‚Äôre up to. It‚Äôs quite likely a current student would benefit from your story. Click to Update your contact info [‚Ä¶]

August 9, 2024|

Philanthropy plays a key role on campus and in the community

The role of philanthropy is pivotal within our campus and local community. Making financial contributions is a straightforward gesture that can initiate a chain reaction of benefits for generations to come. The act of giving is integral to our community, inspiring widespread positive effects.

The experience of giving enriches the lives of donors, cultivating a sense of belonging, generosity, and personal satisfaction. It serves as a powerful means of demonstrating compassion and understanding towards others, acting as a [‚Ä¶]

August 1, 2024|

2024/2025 is off to a great start

The OC Foundation Board of Directors kicked off the new fiscal year at its June full board meeting. They approved an exciting plan to increase financial support, community engagement, and a campus-wide initiative. Highlights include:

Alumni Network

We‚Äôre embarking on a mission to bring Oxnard College graduates and past students back to the Nest. No matter where they live, OC alumni are able to inspire current students through mentorship, recruit students and graduates to appealing jobs, reestablish relationships amongst [‚Ä¶]

July 12, 2024|

Thank you, Dr. Cobian

For the past two years, Dr. Oscar Cobian has been a strong supporter of the OC Foundation. In addition to guiding Oxnard College in an impressive direction, he worked with the Foundation to create new funding opportunities, introduce community leaders to campus programs, and open exciting doors for OC alumni.

His leadership earned him the prestigious Pacific Coast Business Times‚Äô 2024 Educator of the Year Award. He will be recognized at its upcoming Latino Business Awards.

We‚Äôre excited that [‚Ä¶]

July 8, 2024|

Welcome Dr. Gonzalez

The new fiscal year begins with a change in leadership at Oxnard College. The Foundation extends a big welcome to Dr. Roberto Gonzalez as the new Oxnard College President.

Dr. Gonzalez comes to Oxnard College after serving as the vice president of student services, enrollment management and equity initiatives at West Los Angeles College and a former dean at Santa Monica College. He earned a doctorate in higher education administration from the University of Southern California.

‚ÄúI am deeply [‚Ä¶]

July 1, 2024|

Closing a remarkable fiscal year

The month of June is a month to restore and refresh for many people. The OC Foundation took advantage of the month to put the finishing touches on an amazing year, while setting goals for the next. The recent fiscal year was marked by a few highlights, including:

Awarding $275,000 in scholarship grants

Providing $144,000 in campus program support

Adding seven committed campus and community leaders to the board

Attracting a record 528 donors

Hosting a community-impacting [‚Ä¶]

June 12, 2024|

Remarkable OC Graduation

Students earning diplomas and certificates paraded into the Oxnard College Soccer Stadium in front of thousands of family and friends.

The OC Foundation visited with graduates before the commencement exercises to welcome them into the OC Alumni Network.

If you graduated, but did not get a chance to add your name to the OC Alumni Network, complete the very brief graduate form.

May 20, 2024|

Athletic Hall of Fame Banquet a major success

Three amazing members of the Oxnard College family were honored at the third annual OC Athletic Alumni Association Hall of Fame banquet.

Tenley Garcia (soccer) and Jon Larson (baseball) were inducted into the Hall of Fame. Marti Dibble received the prestigious Lifetime Condor Award, due to her long-time dedication to the Athletic Department.

A big thanks is extended to Jonas Crawford and Emily Perez-Delgado for coordinating an exceptional event.

May 15, 2024|

Battalion 61 Graduates

Oxnard College Battalion 61 cadets completed their requirements to earn graduation honors.

The OC Foundation awarded 14 scholarships at the commencement exercises. The 10 recipients received $13,250 in scholarship grants.

May 13, 2024|

Recognizing transfer students

The OC Foundation partnered with the University Transfer Center to acknowledge the academic success of Oxnard College students planning to transfer to four-year universities.

Sixty-two scholarship grants were awarded to 56 transfer students. Thanks the charitable support of many community members, $48,000 was awarded to these exceptional students.

May 9, 2024|

STEM Recognition Ceremony

The OC Foundation is a proud supporter of the Oxnard College School of STEM, which hosted it annual recognition event.

The standing-room only event was held in the Condor Cafe, where students recognized faculty members, alumni, transfer students, and graduates.

May 4, 2024|

May 3, 2024|

TRIO SSS Commencement

Twenty-six incredibly bright minds were recognized at the annual Student Support Services graduation.

The OC Foundation is a strong support of OC‚Äôs Student Support Services program. Over 73% of Oxnard College‚Äôs TRIO SSS students are both first-generation and low-income students paving the way toward a college degree not only for themselves, but for their families.

May 2, 2024|

Successful Family Festival

The third annual OC Family Festival attracted another large crowd of community members onto the Oxnard College campus.

Hundreds of students and campus personnel hosted activities, games, and large kids fun zone. An estimated 3,500 attendees enjoyed live entertainment, shopping at the Marketplace, food trucks, and access to over 40 community organizations. It was an extraordinary success.

The event was coordinated by the Oxnard College Marketing Department, supported by a long list of exceptional leaders, and financially sponsored by [‚Ä¶]

April 29, 2024|

Latino GDP Presentation was a major success

The Latino GDP Presentation was an incredible success. The event welcomed over 200 people in attendance, including students, community and business leaders who learned about the increasing economic impact of the Latino community from Dr. Matthew Fienup and Dr. David Hayes-Bautista, authors of the 2023 U.S. Latino GDP Report.

Their findings were supported by a panel of leaders, who voiced what they see on a local level. Special thanks to moderator, Jorge Mercado, and panelists [‚Ä¶]

April 5, 2024|

Robert England passes away

The OC Foundation mourns the passing of longtime board member, Robert England.

Bob joined the OC Foundation Board of Directors in 2003, bringing keen insight from his experience as an attorney and years of service to several community organizations. By profession, he was an estate planning, trust, probate lawyer, and counsel for Ferguson Case Orr Paterson. He was a certified estate planning specialist and former licensed certified public accountant.

In addition to the OC Foundation, Bob served as [‚Ä¶]

March 29, 2024|

Apply for other scholarships

The OC Foundation plans to award over $250,000 in scholarship grants for the 2024/2025 school year. The transfer application has closed, the continuing/returning application closes on May 31, and the entering application closes on June 21.

Students are not limited to applying for only OC Foundation scholarships. They‚Äôre encouraged to apply for other scholarships. We created a list of additional scholarships on our Scholarships webpage, located at www.oxnardcollegefoundation.org/scholarships/additional-scholarships.

The page features the following locally-based scholarships:

March 25, 2024|

Heredia Recogized by Soroptimist

Congratuations to Brenda Heredia, a member of the OC Foundation Board of Directors, for receiving the 2024 Women Making a Difference Award from Soroptimist International of Oxnard.

In addition to her service to Oxnard College as Secretary of the Foundation Board, she contributes an extraordinary amount of time to Nyeland Promise. She‚Äôs spearheading the Nyland Promise Comrades Unidas program, which empowers Latina women to reach their dreams and goals. It [‚Ä¶]

March 12, 2024|

Speakers announced for April 17 Latino GPD presentation

An outstanding group of leaders will discuss the large and rapidly growing economic contribution of Latinos on April 17 in the Oxnard College Performing Arts Center.

Speakers include:

David Hayes-Bautista, PhD ‚Äì Director of the Center for the Study of Latino Health & Culture at the UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine.

Matthew Fienup, PhD ‚Äì Executive Director of the Center for Economic Research & Forecasting at California Lutheran University.

A panel discussion following the speakers will be moderated [‚Ä¶]

March 11, 2024|

Homeownership Planning Workshop

The OC STEM Alumni Association is hosting a Homeownership Workshop for the entire campus community on Tuesday, March 12 at 5:30pm. Representatives from Bank of America will provide information, important steps, and answers to questions at the workshop, which takes place in Room AA-101 at Oxnard College.

The workshop is ideal for anyone who wishes to own a home someday. You‚Äôll learn what‚Äôs necessary, ways to set financial goals, and tips on what to do next.

Food and beverage [‚Ä¶]

March 7, 2024|

Rotary Club of Oxnard Announces Scholarship

The Rotary Club of Oxnard, in partnership with the Oxnard College Foundation, is pleased to announce a Mental Health Practitioner scholarship opportunity for 2024.

One $2,500 scholarship will be awarded to the 2024 graduate of Oxnard College who has demonstrated high academic achievement, and who intends to continue baccalaureate studies at a university during 2024-25, preparing for a career in the field of mental health and emotional well-being ‚Äì one of the 2023-24 priorities of Rotary International.

The deadline [‚Ä¶]

March 1, 2024|

Transfer Scholarship Application Deadline is February 29

Oxnard College students who plan to transfer to a four-year university in Fall 2024 or Spring 2025 will need to complete the OC Foundation Scholarship Grants Application by February 29th at 11:59pm. Since 2024 is a leap year, students have that extra day in February, though don‚Äôt wait until the last minute and miss this opportunity!

The OC Foundation awards over $250,000 in scholarship grants to Oxnard College recipients every year. The online application process has been simplified [‚Ä¶]

February 19, 2024|

Ventura County Mobile Library visits the Marketplace

The January 31 Oxnard College Community Marketplace attracted over 2,000 people who enjoyed the experience of shopping, food vendors and connecting with over 30 community organizations. As is customary with the last Sunday of the month, the Swap Meet Justice Citizenship and Resource Fair provided invaluable complimentary services to community members. This event welcomed the Ventura County Mobile Library, upon the recommendation of Supervisor Kelly Long.

Serving an important outreach role as the first bookmobile service in California [‚Ä¶]

February 14, 2024|

OC Foundation recognized by Montecito Bank & Trust

The grand opening of the Montecito Bank & Trust Oxnard Branch was recently acknowledged and celebrated in front of a large group of community leaders, customers, and public officials. During the presentation, bank executives presented four local non-profit organizations with contributions. The OC Foundation was selected among the supported charitable organizations.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre honored to be selected as a recipient of Montecito Bank‚Äôs generosity,‚Äù says Pete Parker, OC Foundation Executive Director. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve enjoyed a long-standing relationship and look forward [‚Ä¶]

February 10, 2024|

Join our team of scholarship application reviewers

Scholarship Reviewers Wanted ‚Äì Join the Club!

Perhaps the greatest impact a volunteer can provide through the OC Foundation is by reviewing and scoring scholarship applications. We saw a 232% increase in applications last year and anticipate a similar increase for the 2024/2025 application cycle. With an average of 4-5 hours total, Scholarship Reviewers will receive the training, support, and tools they need to be a part of a committee ‚Äì reading our students‚Äô stories and helping us [‚Ä¶]

Building a brighter future for county‚Äôs families

Interim Oxnard College President, Oscar Cobian, penned the following Op-Ed in the VC Star this week, describing the College‚Äôs work serving the community.

As we enter the new year, there‚Äôs much to be excited about at Oxnard College. After several years of COVID-related downturns, our college is surging ahead. From enrollment increases and new programming to local partnerships and national recognition, Oxnard College ‚Äì along with our sister colleges in Moorpark and Ventura ‚Äì is strongly positioned to [‚Ä¶]

February 1, 2024|

Save the Date ‚Äì Latino GDP Presentation

We are excited to inform you that Oxnard College and the Oxnard College Foundation, in collaboration with California Lutheran University and the West Ventura County Business Alliance, are organizing a 2023-24 Latino Gross Domestic Product (GDP) Report event at Oxnard College.

The event, scheduled for April 17, 2024, from 3:00pm to 4:30pm with a reception to follow, will feature faculty members from California Lutheran University and UCLA who will share insights from the report. The event features a [‚Ä¶]

January 24, 2024|

OC Foundation Spotlight ‚Äì Antonio Rodriguez

Meet Antonio Rodriguez, who recently joined the OC Foundation Board of Directors.

Antonio works as an associate attorney at Staker|Johnson Law Corporation. Antonio‚Äôs practices trust and estate law; he is one of the few Spanish-speaking attorneys in Ventura County who practices in this area of the law. He is a first-generation college graduate who comes from a working-class immigrant family.

Antonio holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Chicana/o Studies and Law & Society, a master‚Äôs degree in Public Policy and [‚Ä¶]

January 22, 2024|

OC STEM Alumni to host social event

The OC STEM Alumni Association welcomes fellow alumni and students to a social gathering on February 6 at Oxnard College.

The event takes place in Room AA-101, beginning at 6:00pm. Light food and refreshments will be offered.

Attendees will enjoy friendly camaraderie, share feedback and advice, and learn the latest with OC‚Äôs STEM program.

RSVPs are not required to attend and the event is free of charge.

Learn more about the STEM Alumni Association at www.oxnardcollegefoundation.org/alumni/stem-alumni.

January 18, 2024|

Nominate a former student-athlete

The Oxnard College Athletic Alumni Association is hosting its 3rd Annual Hall of Fame Banquet on May 11, 2024. The event will recognize former Condor athletes, based on their success as student-athletes, as well as their careers.

Hall of Fame inductees are selected each year, based on a review of nominations.

To be considered for induction this May, all nominations must be received by January 31, 2024.

Submit a Nomination today!

Meet Rachel Jones, who recently joined the OC Foundation Board of Directors.

Rachel currently works for Community West Bank as an AVP, Information System Security Administrator. She holds a BS in Fine Art, MEd. in Secondary Education, a MS in Computer Science, and is currently pursuing her MBA. Rachel has worked previously as a public school elementary teacher in DC before career switching and moving to California. She is still driven with a desire to bring resources and [‚Ä¶]

December 4, 2023|

Alumni News ‚Äì Cristian Rosete ‚Äô23

2023 alumnus, Cristian Rosete, was recently featured in a San Diego State University news story describing his journey of resilience and success.

Cristian transfered for the fall semester, earning a SDSU Guardian Scholars scholarship, which supports students who identify as current or former foster youth, wards of the court or homeless.

We‚Äôre proud of Cristian‚Äôs success, as he‚Äôs a big part of the Oxnard College family.

Read the full story here.

November 8, 2023|

OC Foundation board spotlight: Kaye Placio

Meet Kaye Placio, who recently joined the OC Foundation Board of Directors.

Kaye is currently a Biomedical Engineering major student and the Associated Student Government President (ASG) at Oxnard College. She will be transferring in Fall 2024 to earn her bachelor‚Äôs degree and continue her studies by applying for medical school. She leads the ASG board to amplify student voice and to maintain a quality student experience here at Oxnard College. Kaye chose Oxnard College because of the [‚Ä¶]

November 3, 2023|

Halloween Fun at the Marketplace

We‚Äôre celebrating Halloween at this Sunday‚Äôs Community Marketplace. Bring your family and enjoy entertainment and fun activities. Children will participate in a safe trick-or-treat experience as the Foundation, and vendors distribute tasty treats. The fun will take place between 12pm and 2pm.

It‚Äôs also a Swap Meet Justice Sunday, as 30+ community organizations will provide free services to local community members. Visit any time between 9am and 3pm.

Wear your favorite Halloween costume come on out to Sunday‚Äôs Spooktacular [‚Ä¶]

October 25, 2023|

2024/2025 Scholarship Applications Open Today!

The application period for 2024/2025 scholarship grants open today, October 13.

The application has been designed for students seeking to enter Oxnard College next school year, continue at Oxnard College, or transfer from Oxnard College to a four-year university. Deadlines for each scholarship application category varies. Please refer to the official calendar for key deadlines.

Students seeking financial support for the 2024/2025 school year may complete the scholarship grant application, accessed at the Scholarship Manager portal.

The first [‚Ä¶]

OC Foundation board spotlight: Mari Estrada

Meet Mari Estrada, who recently joined the OC Foundation Board of Directors.

Mari works at Moorpark College as the Program Director of Bachelor Degree Programs, serves as a lecturer for CSU Channel Islands, and adjunct faculty for Fresno City College. Mari‚Äôs work focuses on workforce development which includes professional development and higher education.

As the youngest of four, she felt tremendous pressure to go to college despite limited financial means. Mari fully understands concerns about student loan debt, the [‚Ä¶]

October 9, 2023|

Fire Academy Dedicates Apparatus Bay

The Oxnard College Fire Academy unveiled its latest multi-use facility last week, dedicating it to the Academy‚Äôs founder, Ed French.

Construction began on the $6.4 million state-of-the-art facility in 2019. It provides a learning space for students and cadets to gain hands-on experience with tools and fire science apparatus, helping develop and hone their firefighting skills. The facility also houses the program‚Äôs equipment and fleet of firefighting vehicles.

‚ÄúWe are excited to expand our facilities at Oxnard College‚Äôs esteemed [‚Ä¶]

September 27, 2023|

OC Foundation board spotlight: Maria Thayer

Meet Maria Thayer, who recent joined the OC Foundation Board of Directors.

Maria works at California Lutheran University as the Director of Hispanic-Serving Institution Initiatives and Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Justice Programs. As a first-generation college graduate, Maria‚Äôs mission is to make higher education accessible to all students. She brings 16 years of leadership experience to the campus. She received her bachelor‚Äôs from CSUN in Psychology and Chicana/o Studies, a master‚Äôs from CSUCI in Business Administration (MBA) and [‚Ä¶]

September 20, 2023|

Foundation spotlighted in Giving Guide

The OC Foundation is pleased to be spotlighted in the Pacific Coast Business Times annual Giving Guide.

The two-page layout features information about the Foundation, along with an impressive advertisement about Oxnard College.

Pickup a copy to view other amazing non-profit organizations, which are also strengthening our community. A big thanks to the team at the Pac Biz Times for continuing to promote the business and community engagement of our amazing area.

View the online version of the Giving [‚Ä¶]

September 18, 2023|

Chef Hart featured in Edible Ojai & Ventura County

Oxnard College is home to a world-class culinary arts program. You can find program graduates in many of the restaurants in Ventura County and throughout the world.

Behind every noteworthy program is a passionate and successful leader. At the OC Culinary Arts program, that person is Chef Adam Hart. A member of the OC family since 2016, Adam is a driving force behind the future success of countless students.

Adam [‚Ä¶]

September 15, 2023|

OCF Board Member Featured in Vida

OC Foundation board member, Gabriela Rodriguez, was featured on the front page of today‚Äôs issue of Vida Newspaper for outstanding service to others.

Gabriela is the director of Proyecto Exito, a Title V Grant aimed at helping students determine their career paths.

Raised in Oxnard, she earned a master‚Äôs degree in Education with a Guidance Counselor credential after completing her undergraduate degree in Cultural Anthropology at UC Santa Barbara. She actively serves the community through the [‚Ä¶]

OC Foundation board member, Brenda Heredia, was selected as a recipient of the 40 Under 40 Award presented by the Pacific Coast Business Times.

She‚Äôs a member of the 23rd 40 Under 40 class, which the Biz Times tabs as a select group of the region‚Äôs rising stars.

Brenda provides leadership service to three different organizations, including the OC Foundation, and works for the City of Oxnard. A graduate of Ventura College, Cal State Long Beach, [‚Ä¶]

Deadline to establish a 2024/2025 scholarship nears

As we‚Äôre making the final selections for the 2023/2024 scholarships, we‚Äôre already gearing up for the next round of applications.

The window is open for anyone wishing to create a scholarship to be awarded for the next round of scholarships, but closes on September 22, 2023. This only applies to new scholarships which will be awarded for the next round of applications.

Below are important deadline dates for scholarship fund donors:

August 29, 2023|

Incredible Art Dedication Event!

The Oxnard College Art+Design Complex officially opened its doors for the public to see last night! The occasion was especially exciting, as the dedication was coupled with the unveiling of the new mural, featured in the OC Amphitheater. The celebration also included the McNish Gallery, which received a sizeable contribution from Carnegie Art Cornerstone.

It was an evening of arts celebration.

The OC Foundation is a proud supporter of Oxnard College arts, accentuated by its $500,000 donation to renovate the [‚Ä¶]

August 25, 2023|

Oxnard College Receives $100,000 Grant

Oxnard College Receives $100,000 Grant from Metallica‚Äôs All Within My Hands‚Äô Scholars Initiative

The Grant Will Fund Equipment for Oxnard College‚Äôs Career Education Students

Oxnard, Calif. (Aug. 21, 2023) ‚Äî Oxnard College has been selected to receive a $100,000 grant from the Grammy Award-winning band Metallica and its foundation, All Within My Hands. The award will support students in the college‚Äôs Culinary Arts, Dental Hygiene and Fire Academy programs as the band continues its multimillion-dollar investment in critical workforce [‚Ä¶]

August 22, 2023|

Employee Giving Makes a Difference

Oxnard College is a very special place, home to committed leaders, both in and out of the classroom. The family atmosphere is readily apparent on all areas of campus, nurturing a caring, supportive, and empowering environment to learn and succeed.

Through the OC Foundation, College and District employees are able to invest in the growth and advancement of the College by contributing toward campus programs and scholarship grants. During the 2022/2023 fiscal year, 25 campus leaders contributed a [‚Ä¶]

August 14, 2023|

Bomberos Toss for Scholarships

A large group of fire fighters, many of whom joined by family and friends, assembled at Topa Topa Brewery to raise funds for the latest OC Foundation scholarship to benefit Fire Academy students.

The Ventura County Bomberos, a collection of incredible and motivated fire personnel, hosted its inaugural event on Saturday, July 29. The goal was simple, raise enough funds to award $2,500 for its first allocation. Bomberos‚Äô President, Robert Molina, hopes the first award is presented to [‚Ä¶]

August 1, 2023|

OC Foundation strategic plan invites input

The Oxnard College Foundation is conducting a strategic planning process to identify strategies that will best advance its mission of supporting Oxnard College and its students. The process allows the board, staff, and stakeholders to outline the Foundation‚Äôs most important priorities.

Campus and community members are invited to participate in the strategic planning process by completing a Campus/Community Survey. The purpose is to collect and discuss feedback pertaining to the Foundation‚Äôs programs, resourcefulness, [‚Ä¶]

Entering Scholarship Application Deadline is July 3

Students who are starting their college journeys at Oxnard College for the Fall 2023 semester are encouraged to apply for scholarships by the July 3 deadline. Application workshops are held every Friday, either in person, via Zoom, or in the Foundation office. Visit the Scholarship Calendar for details.

Below is a list of scholarship grants available to students entering Oxnard College for the first time.

June 15, 2023|
